tool.name: CalculateResponse

param.name: Input_evidence_raster_layers
param.dialogReference:
One or more input evidence rasters.

Evidence rasters must be integer rasters.

The environment must be set before running this tool. This includes the General parameters of Workspace, Scratch Workspace, and extent; and the Raster parametes of cell size and mask.

param.name: input_weights_tables
param.dialogReference:
Weights-of-evidence tables for each raster.

Tables must be in same order as evidence rasters they are associated with.

param.name: Ignore missing data
param.dialogReference: Ignored missing data values are converted to NoData values.

param.name: Missing_Data_Value
param.dialogReference:
Default missing data value is -99. If this value is not appropriate because it conflicts with valid evidence values, the user can select another negative value.

The Missing Data value is required to be a negative integer smaller than the other valid values in the evidence raster.

param.name: Unit_Area_sq_km
param.dialogReference: The Unit Area should be a small area relative to the total study area. This area is used as the area of a single training point. The software has a limit for the posterior probability of 0.000001. If the resulting probabilities for a model are smaller than this limit, increasing the unit area will increase the posterior probability. See the WofE Calculate Weights tool for more discussion.

param.name: Output_Post_Probability_raster
param.dialogReference: The posterior probabilty response raster created from the sum of the weights.

param.name: Output_Standard_Deviation_raster
param.dialogReference: A raster with the standard deviation due to the weights. If there is no missing data, this will also be the total standard deviation for the response raster.

param.name: output_md_variance_raster
param.dialogReference: A raster of the variance due to missing data. This raster will only be calculated when missing data are expllicitly defined in at least one evidence layer.

param.name: output_total_std_dev_raster
param.dialogReference: A raster of the total standard deviation due to the weights and missing data. This raster will only be provided when there is explicitlyl defined missing data in at least one evidence layer. When there is no missing data, the standard deviation due to the weights is used for the total standard deviation.

param.name: Output_Confidence_raster
param.dialogReference: A raster showing the confidence that the reported posterior probability is not zero. This is the posterior probability divided by the total standard deviation, an approximite Student T test.

tool.summary: Use this tool to combine the evidence weighted by their associated generalization in the weights-of-evidence table. This tool calculates the posterior probability, standard deviation (uncertainty) due to weights, variance (uncertainty) due to missing data, and the total standard deviation (uncertainty) based on the evidence and how the evidence is generalized in the associated weights-of-evidence tables.The calculations use the Weight and W_Std in the weights table from Calculate Weights.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Use this tool to combine the evidence weighted by their associated generalization in the weights-of-evidence table. This tool calculates the posterior probability, standard deviation (uncertainty) due to weights, variance (uncertainty) due to missing data, and the total standard deviation (uncertainty) based on the evidence and how the evidence is generalized in the associated weights-of-evidence tables.The calculations use the Weight and W_Std in the weights table from Calculate Weights.
